channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: The current status of SNAP — and another food assistance option
item.description: The Trump administration says it will restart SNAP benefits, but will pay out only half the normal amount. But private and other public resources have been available for families needing assistance.
item.content:encoded: The Trump administration says it will restart SNAP benefits, but will pay out only half the normal amount. But private and other public resources have been available for families needing assistance.
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Ludden

item.title: 3 Austrian nuns in their 80s left a retirement home to break into their old convent
item.description: Three Austrian nuns have left a retirement home to break into their old convent — with local support and an Instagram following.
item.content:encoded: Three Austrian nuns have left a retirement home to break into their old convent — with local support and an Instagram following.
item.dc:creator: Esme Nicholson

item.title: To optimize health, sync your habits with your body clock. Here's how
item.description: With darker days ahead after winding back our clocks, one strategy for better health is to align your daily habits, like sleep and meals, with your body's clock.
item.content:encoded: With darker days ahead after winding back our clocks, one strategy for better health is to align your daily habits, like sleep and meals, with your body's clock.
item.dc:creator: Allison Aubrey

item.title: What the last campaign day in the New York City mayoral race looks like
item.description: New York City's mayoral race draws to a close on Tuesday. Frontrunner Zohran Mamdani is urging volunteers to get out the vote. Meanwhile, Andrew Cuomo is hoping for a come-from-behind win.
item.content:encoded: New York City's mayoral race draws to a close on Tuesday. Frontrunner Zohran Mamdani is urging volunteers to get out the vote. Meanwhile, Andrew Cuomo is hoping for a come-from-behind win.
item.dc:creator: Brian Mann

item.title: These key races around the U.S. could have consequences nationally
item.description: Presidential or congressional races aren't on the ballot, but there are some key races around the U.S. that could have consequences nationally. We look at the messages the candidates are running on.
item.content:encoded: Presidential or congressional races aren't on the ballot, but there are some key races around the U.S. that could have consequences nationally. We look at the messages the candidates are running on.
item.dc:creator: Domenico Montanaro

item.title: Phil Jackson reflects on past legends and future potential for NBA's 75th birthday
item.description: NBA coaching legend Phil Jackson and basketball writer Sam Smith take their decades-long friendship to the page in their book Masters of the Game: A Conversational History of the NBA in 75 players.
item.content:encoded: NBA coaching legend Phil Jackson and basketball writer Sam Smith take their decades-long friendship to the page in their book Masters of the Game: A Conversational History of the NBA in 75 players.
item.dc:creator: Juana Summers

item.title: Some lawmakers are worried that Trump is dragging the U.S. into war with Venezuela
item.description: President Trump is escalating boat strikes near Venezuela without ruling out hitting targets in the country. Lawmakers are warning the U.S. may be drifting toward war without a clear justification.
item.content:encoded: President Trump is escalating boat strikes near Venezuela without ruling out hitting targets in the country. Lawmakers are warning the U.S. may be drifting toward war without a clear justification.
item.dc:creator: Michele Kelemen

item.title: Trump is slashing the number of refugees. What does that mean?
item.description: NPR's Juana Summers speaks with Sharif Aly of the International Refugee Assistance Project about President Trump drastically slashing the number of refugees that can enter the U.S.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Juana Summers speaks with Sharif Aly of the International Refugee Assistance Project about President Trump drastically slashing the number of refugees that can enter the U.S.
item.dc:creator: Jonaki Mehta

item.title: Between Halloween and Thanksgiving is another holiday: Jersey Week
item.description: In the Garden State, there's an unusual public school holiday between Halloween and Thanksgiving known as Jersey Week.
item.content:encoded: In the Garden State, there's an unusual public school holiday between Halloween and Thanksgiving known as Jersey Week.
item.dc:creator: Anastasia Tsioulcas

item.title: Cattle rancher reacts to Trump's plan to import more beef from Argentina
item.description: Oren Lesmeister, a fifth-generation cattle rancher in South Dakota and a former Democratic state lawmaker, talks about the White House's plan to quadruple the amount of beef it imports from Argentina.
item.content:encoded: Oren Lesmeister, a fifth-generation cattle rancher in South Dakota and a former Democratic state lawmaker, talks about the White House's plan to quadruple the amount of beef it imports from Argentina.
item.dc:creator: Kathryn Fink
